intro: Scleranthus diander, commonly known as the two-toothed thornweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are narrow and have a distinctive ribbed appearance, with a rough texture. Scleranthus diander is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in dry, open habitats.
